title: Illegal instruction: 4
body:
**Describe the bug**
When executing `asreview lab` on macOS 11.2 I get the following error:

```
Illegal instruction: 4
```

**How can I go about fixing this?** 

*What happened? And what did you expect to happen?*

I installed `asreview` on my _managed_ system using the macOS instructions. I did this on an existing DeepLearning anaconda virtual environment, because I don't want python 3.6+ to mix with the native python version. When I try to execute it or try to get the version I get the error. I expected `asreview` to open up a browser.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the problem:

Initially I installed `asreview`, and did the following:

```
username@macbook ~
$ workon deeplearning
(deeplearning)
username@ macbook ~
$ asreview --version
Illegal instruction: 4
(deeplearning)
```

Next I proceeded to uninstall `asreview` and re-install it again. Sometimes that fixes things, but unfortunately the error persisted.

```
pip install asreview
Collecting asreview
  Using cached asreview-0.16-py3-none-any.whl (2.4 MB)
Requirement already satisfied: rispy in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from asreview) (0.6.0)
Requirement already satisfied: setuptools in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from asreview) (51.1.2)
Requirement already satisfied: openpyxl in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from asreview) (3.0.6)
Requirement already satisfied: pandas in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from asreview) (1.2.0)
Requirement already satisfied: dill in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from asreview) (0.3.3)
Requirement already satisfied: sklearn in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from asreview) (0.0)
Requirement already satisfied: numpy in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from asreview) (1.19.3)
Requirement already satisfied: h5py in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from asreview) (2.10.0)
Requirement already satisfied: flask>=1.1 in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from asreview) (1.1.2)
Requirement already satisfied: flask-cors in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from asreview) (3.0.10)
Requirement already satisfied: xlrd>=1.0.0 in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from asreview) (2.0.1)
Requirement already satisfied: Jinja2>=2.10.1 in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from flask>=1.1->asreview) (2.11.2)
Requirement already satisfied: Werkzeug>=0.15 in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from flask>=1.1->asreview) (1.0.1)
Requirement already satisfied: click>=5.1 in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from flask>=1.1->asreview) (7.1.2)
Requirement already satisfied: itsdangerous>=0.24 in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from flask>=1.1->asreview) (1.1.0)
Requirement already satisfied: MarkupSafe>=0.23 in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from Jinja2>=2.10.1->flask>=1.1->asreview) (1.1.1)
Requirement already satisfied: Six in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from flask-cors->asreview) (1.15.0)

Requirement already satisfied: jdcal in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from openpyxl->asreview) (1.4.1)

Requirement already satisfied: python-dateutil>=2.7.3 in ./.virtualenvs/deeplearning/lib/python3.7/site-packages (from pandas->asreview) (2.8.1)

Successfully installed asreview-0.16
(deeplearning)
username@macbook ~
$ asreview --version
Illegal instruction: 4
(deeplearning)
username@ macbook ~

```

**Screenshots**
none

**Version information**
 - OS: macOS 11.2
 - ASReview version [e.g. 0.6.2]: 0.16 (I figured this based on the output of the installation command)

**Additional context**
none

Many thanks!

Sander
